---
title: "Creating a new repository on PhEpiGit"
---

A new repository can be initiated using the command line, RStudio, or GitHub. However, this document will specifically describe the process using GitHub, as it facilitates compliance with the reproducible research SOP.

Once employees become PhEpiGit members, they have write permissions, allowing them to clone, pull, and push to all PhEpiGit repositories.

PhEpiGit provides a **project_template** repository that should be used each time a member creates a new repository. This template includes all the folders indicated in PhEpi-1-05_Reproduzierbares Arbeiten.

1. Go to the upper-right corner of the PhEpiGit and select +, among the options select **New repository**

![Create a new repository](images/newrepo.svg){#fig-newrepo .absolute top=160 left=380 width="700"}

2. Select the **Pharmacoepidemiology-UHHD/project_template** (see xxx) to create the new repository (A). This automatically will select the PhEpi as owner. Name the repository (B) and choose a repository visibility (C). Additionally you can add a description. Lastly, click **Create repositry**

While GitHub enables repository management tasks, complete control can be achieved using a command line text editor or tools such as RStudio. This SOP emphasizes utilizing RStudio as a central element for effective GitHub repository management.
